metadata.title: CVE-2014-2442 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL Server 5.6.15 and earlier allowsremote authenticated users to affect availability via vectors related toMyISAM.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2442` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mysql-client-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-client-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-common-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-server-core-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-source-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
mysql-testsuite-5.6 - 5.6.16-1~exp1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.6 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.16-1~exp1').
